body: Can you share the full error from `powershell.Streams.Error`? This is important to try and figure out if the error is failing to load the `libmi` library or an actual connection error from WSMan.

"[outlook.office365.com] An error has occurred which PowerShell cannot handle. A remote session might have ended."


  | Name | Value | Type
-- | -- | -- | --
◢ | [0] | {[outlook.office365.com] An error has occurred which PowerShell cannot handle. A remote session might have ended.} | System.Management.Automation.ErrorRecord
◢ | CategoryInfo | {OpenError: (System.Management.A…tion.RemoteRunspace:RemoteRunspace) [New-PSSession], PSRemotingDataStructureException} | System.Management.Automation.ErrorCategoryInfo
▶ | Exception | {"An error has occurred which PowerShell cannot handle. A remote session might have ended."} | System.Exception {System.Management.Automation.Remoting.PSRemotingDataStructureException}
  | FullyQualifiedErrorId | "PSSessionOpenFailed" | string
▶ | InvocationInfo | Command = {New-PSSession} | System.Management.Automation.InvocationInfo
Hmm I’m not sure why this is sorry it is not what I was expecting.

Remoting working group: @techienickb Please update the issue description with all the information from the issue template which is here: https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/Bug_Report.md

Any update on this issue?  Testing in .net 6 and the latest preview (7.2.0) of the SDK.


Found a solution, re-enable the Binary Formatter Serialization.  I don't understand how powershell remote needs this when remote powershell is a core part of powershell but at least I have a working solution.
`<EnableUnsafeBinaryFormatterSerialization>true</EnableUnsafeBinaryFormatterSerialization>`
Any updates? Can't PS remote from Azure Function (C#, net6) even when EnableUnsafeBinaryFormatterSerialization is enabled in project
